name: Linguine and Quinoa Meatballs With Tangy Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 1/4 cup olive oil 1 teaspoon hot red pepper flakes
1 large onion, finely chopped One 28-­‐ounce can tomatoes, chopped, with juices
3 celery stalks, halved lengthwise and thinly 4 garlic cloves, minced
1 large carrot, quartered lengthwise and thinly Salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 tablespoons canola oil 3 tablespoons fresh parsley leaves, chopped fine
1 small onion, finely chopped 1/2 teaspoon salt
1 pound lean ground turkey 3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 cups cooked quinoa 1 pound linguine (I use a short pasta like penne or
1/2 cup finely grated parmesan cheese bow tie pasta)
1 egg 1 large handful fresh basil leaves
steps: To make the sauce, heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, celery, carrot, and red
pepper flakes and cook until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the tomatoes, garlic, and vinegar and simmer
for 20 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside to keep warm.
To make the meatballs, preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Heat the canola oil in a small skillet over medium
heat. Add the onion and cook, partially covered, until very soft, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat
In a large mixing bowl, combine the beef, quinoa, Parmesan, egg, parsley, salt, pepper, and cooled onions.
Stir until a smooth, homogenous mixture has formed.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until nicely browned but still soft to the touch.
In a large pot of boiling water, cook the linguine al dente. Serve the pasta with some meatballs and the sauce
and top with a sprinkling of torn basil leaves.
